entities.description: Groups within selected census tracts used to form second-stage sampling units.
A segment can be either a field enumeration segment or an ABS segment, defined for sampling purposes.
A segment with sufficient ABS coverage that can be identified using the SEGID variable.
Smaller geographic areas created by partitioning selected census block groups into smaller segments.
A division within a census tract, identified using the STATE, SSREGION, and SEGID variables.
Selected units within segments used for survey sampling.
Individuals selected within screened DUs based on age group composition.
A geographic variable used for classification and sampling.
A person-level variable used to determine selection of individuals.
The effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on data collection and response rates.
Staff members who directed and coordinated data collection efforts for NSDUH.
Field data collection method involving in-person activities.
Data collection method involving web-based activities.

relationships.description: Indicates that a sample tract contains census block groups.
Indicates that census block groups can be identified using the STATE variable.
Indicates that census block groups contain segments for sampling.
Indicates that a segment has sufficient ABS coverage.
Shows that census block groups are partitioned into field enumeration segments.
Indicates that the selection of individuals is based on age.
Indicates the impact of COVID-19 on data collection processes.
Indicates that RTI staff coordinated the data collection efforts.
Indicates that in-person data collection includes field activities.
Indicates that web data collection includes online activities.
